Characteristics of the mind [an1.60:1.2]: It is corrupted by passing corruptions
An uneducated ordinary person does not truly understand this
The uneducated ordinary person has no development of the mind
This mind is freed from passing corruptions
An educated noble disciple truly understands this
The educated noble disciple has development of the mind
Characteristics of a mendicant who culti: They're called a mendicant who does not lack absorption
They do not eat the country’s alms in vain
Intention shapes all phenomena whatsoever that are unskillful, part of the unskillful, on the side of the unskillful
Intention is the first of those phenomena to arise, and unskillful phenomena follow right behind
Intention shapes all phenomena whatsoever that are skillful, part of the skillful, on the side of the skillful
Intention is the first of those phenomena to arise, and skillful phenomena follow right behind
Factors that give rise to unskillful and: Negligence gives rise to unskillful qualities and makes skillful qualities decline
Diligence gives rise to skillful qualities and makes unskillful qualities decline
Laziness gives rise to unskillful qualities and makes skillful qualities decline
